<p><b><font class="Apple-style-span" size="6">Custom Order of Filters</font></b></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in 0.0001pt">&nbsp;</p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in 0.0001pt"><font class="Apple-style-span" size="3">Beginning with&nbsp; Urchin 7.0, the user can control the order in which log and profile filters are applied during Profile processing.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in 0.0001pt"><font class="Apple-style-span" size="3"><br>
</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in 0.0001pt"><font class="Apple-style-span" size="3">New "Up" and "Down" arrows on the Profile Settings\Filters and </font><font class="Apple-style-span" size="3">Log Source Settings</font><font class="Apple-style-span" size="3">\Log Filters tabs allow the user to change the order of filters applied to profile or log source.</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in 0.0001pt"><br>
</p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in 0.0001pt"></p>
<div id="lij-" style="text-align:left">
<p><img src="File?id=ddjk3d43_13fkxq4kf8_b" style="height:387px;width:699px"></p>
</div>
<br>
<p style="margin:0in 0in 0.0001pt"><font class="Apple-style-span" size="3">If filters are defined for profile and log source simultaneously, log-level filters are applied first. It is also important to note that lookup table, search&amp;replace and advanced filters can create new field values and modify the existing ones. Users should take it into consideration when specifying the filter processing order.&nbsp;</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in 0.0001pt"><br>
</p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in 0.0001pt"><font class="Apple-style-span" size="3"><font class="Apple-style-span" size="3">The ability to change filter order is reserved for Super Admin and Account Admin users. </font><br>
</font></p>
<p style="margin:0in 0in 0.0001pt"><font class="Apple-style-span" size="3">&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <br>
</font></p>
<br>
